SLB,WRAPUP 2-Schlumberger, Baker top estimates with global drilling Oct 18 Increased oilfield activity in U.S. offshore waters and overseas gave a bigger-than-expected lift to profits at Schlumberger Ltd and Baker Hughes Inc , marking a clear divide with struggling smaller U.S. oil services firms. ~Schlumberger profit rises on strong drilling worldwide Schlumberger Ltd , the world's largest oilfield services company, reported a better-than-expected 20 percent rise in quarterly profit as offshore drilling increased in North America and demand from the Middle East and Asia rose. ~UPDATE 1-Schlumberger profit rises on strong drilling worldwide Oct 18 Schlumberger Ltd, the world's largest oilfield services company, reported a better-than-expected 20 percent rise in quarterly profit as offshore drilling increased in North America and demand from the Middle East and Asia rose. ~UPDATE 1-Baker Hughes profit up on strong international drilling Oct 18 Baker Hughes Inc, the world's third-largest oilfield services company, reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit, driven by strong drilling activity in the Middle East and Asia Pacific. ~Schlumberger profit rises 20 pct as global drilling booms Oct 18 Schlumberger Ltd, the world's largest oilfield services company, reported a 20 percent rise in quarterly profit as global drilling activity remained buoyant. ~
TXT,UPDATE 3-Cessna maker's profit falls as businesses delay spending * Income from cont ops $0.35/share vs $0.48 a year earlier ~Textron profit falls as Cessna sales hit air pocket Cessna maker Textron Inc  reported a 31 percent fall in quarterly profit from continuing operations due to sluggish sales of its jets as small business owners delay spending in an uncertain U.S. economy. ~Textron profit dives as Cessna aircraft sales fall Oct 18 Textron Inc, the world's largest maker of business aircraft, reported a 31 percent fall in quarterly profit from continuing operations due to sluggish sales of its Cessna aircraft. ~
WMT,Wal-Mart offers to rehire employee fired for aiding attacked woman Oct 18 A Michigan man who was fired by Wal-Mart after he defended a woman who was attacked in a store parking lot during his meal break has been offered his job back, the company said on Friday. ~India probe into Wal-Mart investment moves to central bank: sources MUMBAI/NEW DELHI An investigation by Indian authorities into whether Wal-Mart Stores Inc violated local investment rules in 2010 has been referred to the country's central bank, officials familiar with the matter said. ~
